subject: History
title: Harvey and Blood Circulation
description: A quick, practical guide to Harvey and Blood Circulation.

hook.text: For centuries, doctors believed the liver constantly made new blood. William Harvey proved blood goes in circles.

buildup.text: Harvey dissected living animals and observed the heart pumping blood through arteries and back through veins.

discovery.text: He calculated the heart pumps 60 pints per hourâ€”far too much to be made fresh by the liver.

twist.text: He published in 1628 and was ridiculed. His medical practice collapsed because patients feared his 'radical' ideas.

climax.text: Within a generation, his model was accepted. Bloodlettingâ€”the most common treatment in historyâ€”began its slow decline.

punchline.text: Proving blood circulates nearly ended his career.

quiz.question: How did Harvey prove blood circulates rather than being constantly produced?
options: He used a microscope to watch blood cells move
He calculated the heart pumps too much blood for the liver to make fresh
He dyed blood and watched it return to the heart
